metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0240 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: There is a logic error in io_uring's implementation which can be used to trigger a use-after-free vulnerability leading to privilege escalation. In the io_prep_async_work function the assumption that the last io_grab_identity call cannot return false is not true, and in this case the function will use the init_cred or the previous linked requests identity to do operations instead of using the current identity. This can lead to reference counting issues causing use-after-free. We recommend upgrading past version 5.10.161.

notes.Note: sbeattie> no fixes information given, so using 2b188cc1bb85 ("Add io_uring IO interface") as an upper bounds on affected versions; this is almost surely incorrect.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
